title: Educating head porters in vocations

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal does not relate to Cardano community or to blockchain in any way, thus there is no reason to assess it in relation to Fund7. 

For the proposer's future application, please read and understand the purpose and criteria of the funding you are applying for first, before submitting your application. 

For the project to develop outside of Fund7: Please consider justifying the return of impact on the investment of USD $40,000 into training 5-10 individuals. What would be the long-term impact? why your project is different from many more vocational projects that are being run in Ghana, and Africa in general? How can you make this project more sustainable, continuous, self-sustained and long-term? What would be your operation model to achieve those?
f6_assessments.q1:
Rated 1 for being unrelated to Cardano community. 

For the project to develop outside of Fund7: From considering the impact questions, please build a long-term plan with clear roadmap and milestones and KPIs to achieve your vision. There are many published case studies and new learnings on vocational training that you can easily search and benchmark from the Internet. One good example is the Out of School Youth Education program from Educate! Africa: https://www.experienceeducate.org/.
f6_assessments.q2:
Rated 1 for being unrelated to Cardano community. 

For the project to develop outside of Fund7: After considering previous comments, please also consider describe your definition of success (in both qualitative and quantitative measures), further develop measuring and auditing approach into your working steps.

f6_assessments.q0: Though this proposal is noble, its effort to provide vocational education may be misplaced. Vocational education aim is to prepare individuals with basic academic skills, industry specific skill and a broad set of transferable skills through a curriculum so these individuals would be able to find employment with the skills learned. There is no clear explanation what type of skills will be provided but since this proposal is requesting funds from Project Catalyst, we can assume the proposer wants to provide education on blockchain. If that's the case, then perhaps Cardano is not ready yet for they are still trying to find the best methods of educating for mass adoption. There is no clear bridge that guides someone from a conceptual level to a technical level. Then there's the situation of the landscape of blockchain job opportunities in the Ghana perhaps is non-existent. If the goal is to provide education so they can have a role in Project Catalyst then the whole proposal's approach should be worded different, perhaps in future iteration it could be worded as following; 'Providing Free Workshops on Opportunities in Project Catalyst.' Though this proposal addresses a problem in the Challenge setting, due to data available it at best only partially provides solution to the problem. This proposal unfortunately is not effective in addressing the Challenge and highly recommend to connect with these two following entities, WADA and Catalyst School. WADA (an African base Cardano community) to get a better feel how to integrate Africa with Cardano and Catalyst School to learn on how to submit a proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no further detailed information that is fleshed out in the proposal, for example; providing info of the location of the training that the proposer has done, providing a description what was trained, providing information trainer was in collaboration/under what entity, provide documentation etc. Then the fact there is no implementation plan, budget details or timeline provided makes implementing this proposal highly unsuccessful. Again, recommend to contact Catalyst School or for starters to look over all the recorded workshop held by Catalyst School in their YouTube channel.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no roadmap with milestones, no measurable KPI's make this proposal very difficult to audit. Though problem statement and solution are interconnected, they are not integrated well with the Challenge parameters. Please do make an effort to contact Catalyst School and return with a revised proposal.
